abstract: Wall Street Rocks, a fund-raiser for military veterans and their families, exposed a wild side of Wall Street — one that won’t draw the ire of regulators.
snippet: Wall Street Rocks, a fund-raiser for military veterans and their families, exposed a wild side of Wall Street — one that won’t draw the ire of regulators.
lead_paragraph: By day, Neil Holstein wears a suit to his job as a managing director at JPMorgan Chase. But on Tuesday night, he let his hair down, dressed in denim and played bass on stage before an audience of his colleagues on Wall Street.

headline.main: Wall Streeters Trade Pinstripes for Chords

abstract: Authorities are responding to current and former JPMorgan financial advisers who said they had felt pressure to sell the bank’s products even when cheaper or better performing options were available.
snippet: Authorities are responding to current and former JPMorgan financial advisers who said they had felt pressure to sell the bank’s products even when cheaper or better performing options were available.
lead_paragraph: Regulators are examining JPMorgan Chase’s sales tactics, after claims that the nation’s largest bank pushed its own mutual funds over competitors’ investments.

headline.main: Many Regulators Put Their Attention on How JPMorgan Marketed Its Funds

byline.original: By Susanne Craig and Jessica Silver-Greenberg
